results.title: Golf: a special kind of joy
results.creator_credit: Tom Hilderbrand and National Golf Foundation
results.brief_description: Part 1 of the Modern Golf Instruction series. Places importance on building a swing to suit each individual player. Looks at the role of each golf club in obtaining loft and length and demonstrates the use of each club group. The language of golf is discussed and the handicap system explained.

results.title: Golden Transvaal
results.creator_credit: John Da Silva and South African Tourist Corporation
results.brief_description: Within the borders of the Transvaal is to be found a wide diversity of attractions, both natural and manmade. These include Johannesburg, historic Pretoria, the flat plains and mountain ranges and the warm sub-tropical Lowveld, and the Kruger National Park.

results.title: Gold the sacred metal
results.creator_credit: Jeri Sopanen, Lewis Bushnell and Kena Productions
results.brief_description: This film is about gold and what people will do for and with it. For gold, the Conquistadors waged wars and with their superior weapons defeated the Latin American Indians. The film shows the descendants of these Indians, the Koguis, who still survive in small villages. Twice a year they dance with golden masks.

results.creator_credit: A G Harbrow and United Salvage

results.title: Going to school
results.creator_credit: David Gibson and Dept of Education, New Zealand
results.brief_description: Explores a child’s first days at school. This exciting experience has its problems, fears and joys. It also describes the parents and teachers reactions. Suitable for tertiary and teacher levels.

results.title: Going Solo
results.brief_description:
Through life experiences such as divorce, bereavement or never meeting the right soulmate we may find ourselves fifty plus and living on our own. For some in this situation a new partner is not what they crave, just the supportive friendship of those who understand.

Based on a series of interviews conducted with members of a Catholic Women’s solo group, this 36 min amateur documentary is a first time effort for the filmmaker and although the production values are at times questionable - the heart and soul of the women interviewed shine through making this a warm, often funny and inspirational account of life for a growing number of people in our community.

results.title: Godard 80
results.brief_description: The famous French director Jean-Luc Godard is interviewed by British film theorist Peter Wollen and the editor of “Framework”, Don Ranveaud. He talks of the developments in his work, the change in style epitomised by his most recent film “Sauve Qui Peut”, his work with Francis Ford Coppola and the relationships between his previous films and the new one. He also discusses his radical method of scriptwriting and the critical responses to his latest film.

results.title: God with a green face
results.creator_credit: Bruce A. Ward, Myron Emery and American Society for Eastern Arts
results.brief_description: This colourful introduction to India’s greatest theatre tradition - the dance-drama of Kathakali features the Kerala Kalamadalam Company performing dances of the State of Kerala which have evolved out of the Sanskrit tradition and the indigenous Dravidian culture. The dancers display a great richness of costume, vivid colour and originality of head-dress.
